intro: Commiphora porensis, commonly known as the African myrrh, is a small evergreen shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Burseraceae family, which includes frankincense and myrrh-producing plants. The plant is characterized by its aromatic resinous sap, which has been used traditionally for medicinal and incense purposes. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy coating. Commiphora porensis typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
